decision_conditions: The proposed Class B8 (storage and distribution, including warehousing) use within a residential area, if permitted would give rise to noise and disturbance to the detriment of the reasonable amenity of the occupiers of nearby properties and contrary to Policies DC11 and DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD.

The proposed development, by reason of its scale, bulk and position close to the boundaries of the site, be a cramped and visually intrusive form of development, out of scale and character with the prevailing pattern of rear garden development, and having a dominant and overbearing impact, loss of outlook and increased sense of enclosure detrimental to the amenity of nearby residents contrary to Policy DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with the adopted planning policies, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to Mr Hussain (Agent) on 06/08/2020.
description: Single storey storage unit with flat roof and bricks wall finish to match local architecture
